title: 111_hr1182
content: The Act titled "Military Spouses Residency Relief Act" guarantees residency for military personnel spouses for voting purposes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for military spouses voting for federal, state, or local offices while accompanying their spouse on military orders, ensuring they do not lose their residency or acquire a new one in another state. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for military spouses voting for federal, state, or local offices while accompanying their spouse on military orders, ensuring they do not lose their residency or acquire a new one in another state. Additionally, the Act is updated to include language regarding spouses of military personnel in the section heading. A clerical amendment is made to the table of contents in the Act. The amendment guarantees residency for military personnel and their spouses, regardless of their location due to military orders. It also determines the tax residence of military spouses. The amendment to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act ensures that military spouses maintain their residency for tax purposes regardless of their location to be with the servicemember in compliance with military orders. The amendment to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act exempts income of military spouses from being considered as income in a tax jurisdiction if they are not residents of that jurisdiction but are there to be with the servicemember in compliance with military orders. The amendment to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act allows military spouses' income to be exempt from state or local income tax if they are not residents but are present due to military orders. This applies to tax returns starting from the enactment of the Act. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act has been amended to suspend the land rights residency requirement for spouses of military personnel. This change applies to servicemembers in military service on or after the enactment of the Act.
